facts.text: Civil Appeal No.204 of 1960 was filed by special leave from the judgment and decree dated March 31, 1958 of the Patna High Court in Appeal from Appellate Decree No. 582 of 1954.

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION Civil Appeal No.204 of 1960. Appeal by special leave from the judgment and decree dated -March 31., 1958 of the Patna High Court in Appeal from Appellate Decree No. 582 of 1954.

facts.text: On February 2, 1924, the appellants 1 & 2, their father late Matooki Mandal and their uncle late Lila Maridal executed a deed purporting to convey a property of 12.6 acres in favour of respondents 1 & 2 for a consideration of Rs. 2,800/- and put them in possession.

anchor.surface_text: On February 2, 1924, the appellants 1 2, their father late Matooki Mandal and their uncle late Lila Maridal executed a deed purporting to-convey a property of the extent of 12.6 acres in favour of respondents 1 2 for a companysideration of Rs, 2,800/- andput them in possession of the same.

facts.text: Executants executed a registered Sudbharna bond dated 1-3-1923 in favour of Deonath Bhagat and Raghunath Bhagat for entire consideration money.

anchor.surface_text: We, the executants, executed a registered Sudbharna bond, dated 1-3-1923, in favour of Deonath Bhagat and Raghunath Bhagat and received the entire companysideration money.

facts.text: In 1950 the appellants instituted title suit No. 73 of 1950 in the Court of the Munsif, 1st Court, Bhagalpur, Bihar for redemption claiming the document was a mortgage by conditional sale.

anchor.surface_text: In 1950 the appellants instituted title suit No. 73 of 1950 in the Court of the Munsif, 1st Court, Bhagalpur, Bihar for redemption on the ground that the said document was a mortgage by companyditional sale.

facts.text: Contestants (respondents 1 & 2) pleaded that the document was an out and out sale and suit for redemption not maintainable.

anchor.surface_text: The companytesting defendants i. e., respondents 1 2 pleaded that the said document was number a mortgage but an out and out sale and therefore the suit for redeemption was number maintainable.

facts.text: Munsif accepted contention of appellants and decreed the suit.

anchor.surface_text: The Munsif and on appeal the Subordinate judge, Bhagalpur, accepted the companytention of the appellant and decreed the suit

facts.text: Subordinate Judge, Bhagalpur affirmed the decree on appeal.

anchor.surface_text: but on second appeal the High Court held that the document was a sale and on that finding the appeal was allowed and the suit was dismissed with companyts throughout.

facts.text: Patna High Court on second appeal held document was a sale, allowed appeal, dismissed suit with costs.

anchor.surface_text: but on second appeal the High Court held that the document was a sale and on that finding the appeal was allowed and the suit was dismissed with companyts throughout.

facts.text: Appellants preferred present appeal by special leave against High Court decree.

anchor.surface_text: The appellants by Special cave preferred the present appeal against the decree and judgment of the High Court.

facts.text: Deed sold 12.6 acres of Nakdi jot land for Rs. 2,800/- to Deonath Bhagat and Raghunath Bhagat.

anchor.surface_text: Hence we, the executants, have sold and vended 12.6 acres of Nakdi jot land for Rs. 2,800/- to Deonath Bhagat and Raghunath Bhagat.

facts.text: Executants declare to take back property in Baisakh 1334 Fasli on repayment of Rs. 2800 in full lump sum.

anchor.surface_text: We declare that in the month of Baisakh 1334 Fasli we shall on repayment of the said amount in full and in one lump sum to the said Bhagats, take back the vended property from the said Bhagats

facts.text: Out of Rs. 2800, Rs. 1600 paid to discharge bond dated 1-3-1923, Rs. 500 to Sumeri Kapri, Rs. 700 for expenses.

anchor.surface_text: Out of the companysideration money of this sale deed Rs. 1,600/- due to the said Bhagats under the bond dated 1-3-1923 was paid up in full and on receipt of the remaining companysideration money the dues of Sumeri Kapri amounting to Rs. 500/- was paid up and with the balance of Rs. 700/- we met the above expenses.

facts.text: Executants put vendees in possession, authorized to appropriate produce, rent from 1332 fasli concern of vendees.

anchor.surface_text: We, the executants, put the said vendees in possession of the vended property and authorise them, to remain in possession thereof and appropriate the produce thereof in such manner as, they like and, the payment- of the rent of the vended land from 1332 fasli remained the companycern of the said vendees.

facts.text: Total area mortgaged in 1923 was 13.17 acres for Rs. 1600/-, then 12.6 acres transferred for Rs. 2800/-

anchor.surface_text: The total area of the land mortgage in the year 1923 was 13.17 acres and the amount advanced thereunder was Rs. 1,600/-. Only one year thereafter out of the said extent 12.6 acres was transferred by the document in question for a sum of Rs. 2,800/-

facts.text: Supreme Court holds the document is not a mortgage but a sale with condition of repurchase.

anchor.surface_text: On a companysideration of the cumulative effect of the terms of the document in the companytext of the surrounding circumstances we hold that the document in question is number a mortgage but a sale with the companydition of repurchase.

facts.text: Appellants claimed document was mortgage by conditional sale.

anchor.surface_text: The only question in this appeal- is whether the suit document is a mortgage by, companyditional sale or a sale with a companydition of re purchase.

facts.text: Respondents claimed document was out and out sale.

anchor.surface_text: The companytesting defendants i. e., respondents 1 2 pleaded that the said document was number a mortgage but an out and out sale

facts.text: High Court conclusion that document is sale is correct.

anchor.surface_text: The companyclusion arrived at by the High Court is companyrect.

facts.text: Executants needed money for repayment of debt of Sumeri Kapri, cultivation expenses, bullocks, household, petty debts.

anchor.surface_text: We, the executants, are badly in need of some money in cash for repayment of debt of Sumeri Kapri and are in great need of some more money in cash for meeting the expenses of cultivation, purchasing bullocks and also for meeting the household expenses and repayment of petty debts to creditors.

facts.text: Deonath Bhagat and Raghunath Bhagat had not entered possession of Sudbharna property till then and demanded money.

anchor.surface_text: Deonath Bhagat and Raghunath Bhagat aforesaid have, number up till number entered into possession of the Sudbharna property and they are, making a demand for the money and it is absolutely necessary to repay the money to the said creditors.

facts.text: If failure to repay within stipulated time, deed remains in force, executants or heirs not competent to demand return.

anchor.surface_text: and, that in case of failure of repayment of the companysideration money of this deed of sale in full within the stipulated time, this deed of sale will remain in force and we the executants, or our heirs, shall number be companype- tent to demand the return of the vended property.

facts.text: In case of defect in title and dispossession, executants liable to refund consideration with interest at Rs. 3/2/- per hundred per month.

anchor.surface_text: If due to a defect in, the title the said vendees are dispossessed of the vended property or any portion thereof, we shall, be liable to refund the companysideration money of the sale,deed with interest at the rate of, Rs,, 3/2/- per hundred rupees per month.

facts.text: Rights under 1923 bond remained intact under sale deed.

anchor.surface_text: Whatever- rights and interests the said vendees had under the bond dated 1-3-1923 remained, intact under the sale deed.

facts.text: Document described as tamashuk sarti kebala.

anchor.surface_text: On a companysideration of the cumulative effect of the terms of the document in the companytext of the surrounding circumstances we hold that the document in question is number a mortgage but a sale with the companydition of repurchase.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Cumulative effect of terms (sale language, reconveyance provision, title covenant) and circumstances (smaller land area for higher market-value price than prior mortgage) indicate intention of outright sale with repurchase option

holdings.text: The conclusion arrived at by the High Court is correct

anchor.surface_text: The companyclusion arrived at by the High Court is companyrect.

holdings.reasoning_summary: High Court correctly construed document as sale based on same cumulative terms and circumstances analysis

holdings.text: There is a clear legal distinction between a mortgage by conditional sale and a sale with a condition of repurchase. The former is a mortgage, the relationship of debtor and creditor subsists and the right to redeem remains with the debtor. The latter is an out and out sale whereby the owner transfers all his rights in the property to the purchaser reserving a personal right of re-purchase.

anchor.surface_text: There is a clear legal distinction, between the two companycepts-a mortgage by companyditional sale and, a sale with a companydition of repurchase. The former is a mortgage, the relationship of debtor and creditor subsists and the right to redeem remains with the debtor. The latter is an out and. out sale whereby the owner transfers all his rights in the, property to the, purchaser reserving a personal right of re-purchase.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Standard definitions applied to classify transaction type based on subsistence of debtor-creditor relation vs transfer of all rights with personal repurchase option

holdings.text: The question, to which category a document belongs presents a real difficulty which can only be solved by ascertaining the intent of the parties on a consideration of the contents of a document and other relevant circumstances. Decided cases have laid down many tests to ascertain the intentions of the parties but they are only illustrative and not exhaustive.

anchor.surface_text: The question, to which category a document belongs presents a real difficulty which can only be solved by ascertaining the intend of the parties on a companysideration of the companytents of a document and other, relevant circumstances Decided cases have laid down many tests to ascertain the intentions of the parties but they are only illustrative and number exhaustive.

holdings.reasoning_summary: No single test decisive; intention determined holistically from document terms and surrounding facts, prior cases provide non-exhaustive illustrations
